inlineContent.text: I was watching Olympic volleyball today and during a timeout we got to overhear the coaches telling their players the strategy. The point that stuck out — even the announcers commented on it — was targeting the players in positions 5 and 6 on the serve. They hoped to take advantage of weakness.
This is a sound, logical strategy. Winning is important and targeting weakness increases your odds of winning. But I don’t like it and I try not to do it.
I don’t want to win by beating the worst players on the other team. I want to test myself against the best of them. That’s a true victory to me.

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
